intro: Caraguata angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf caraguata, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
